result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany Lynn Richard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brittany Lynn Richard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brittany Lynn Richard was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 8 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Pay all court costs. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
